_description: James Ryman (?), A carol of the Annunciation — thirteen 6-line stanzas (aabaab) and 4-line burden (cdcd), or 4-line stanzas with leonine rhyme in odd-numbered lines (as it is written in MS); burden: ‘Thys ys fulle tru þis ys fulle tru / Who can sey Nay to thys / Mary ys modere of Ihesu / And god hys fadere ys’

Label: An angel came unto that maid
_description: James Ryman (?), A carol of the Annunciation — six cross-rhymed quatrains (abab) and two-line burden with medial rhyme: ‘Mary so myld scripture seyeth þus / Hath borne a chyld namyd Ihesus’

Label: An angel came with full great light
_description: James Ryman, A carol of the Annunciation — four cross-rhymed quatrains (abab) and four-line burden: ‘I bryng tydyngys thatte be fulle tru / Who can sey nay to thys / Mary is moder of Ihesu / And god ys ffader ys’

Label: An angel fro heaven gan light
_description: A song of the Knot of the Trinity — five quatrains and two-line burden: ‘Off al the knottes that I se / I prese the knot in Trinite’

Label: An angel said to that maid so free
Note: For a variant text see 475.
_description: James Ryman (?), A carol of the Annunciation — eight quatrains (aaab) and three-line burden (ccb): ‘Mary so mylde so meke so fre / Hath borne a chylde of hyghe degre / And his name ys Ihesus’

Label: An angel that was fair and bright
Note: For a variant of this song see 473.
_description: James Ryman (?), A carol of the Annunciation — nine quatrains (aaab) and two-line burden (bb): ‘Heyle mary meyden meke and mylde / Thou shalte conceyue and bere a chylde’

Label: Another year it may betide
_description: An Epiphany carol — three quatrains(aaab) and burden: ‘Who wot nowe þat ys here / Where he schall be anoder yere’

Label: As Holy Kirk makes mind / Intrauit ventris thalamum
_description: A macaronic carol of the Nativity — nine quatrains (abab) and two-line burden: ‘The almyghty Kyng of blys / Assumpsit carnem virginis’

Label: As I came walking by the way / I saw a sight seemly to see
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 179.
_description: A song of the Angels appearing to the Shepherds — four 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) including a Latin refrain, ‘Veritas de terra orta est’ plus burden (cc): ‘Man move thy mynd and ioy this fest / Verytas de terra orta est’

Label: As I lay upon a night
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 188.
_description: A carol of the Annunciation — five quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘Redemptoris mater’ plus burden (bb): ‘Now syng we all in fere / Alma redemptoris mater’

Label: As I me rode this ender day
_description: A Love Adventure — reconstructed as three 7-line stanzas (ababbbc) with 3-line burden: ‘Nou sprinkes the sprai / Al for loue icche am so seek / Þat slepen i ne mai’

Label: As I sat upon a straw
Note: Formerly 102.3; Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 196.
_description: A carol lacking first and sixth stanzas — six quatrains (abab) and 2-line burden (bb): ‘Newes newes newes newes / Ye never herd so many newes’

Label: As I went me for to solace / I heard a man sigh
_description: ‘The dred of deth do troble me’ — eight quatrains (aaab) with this refrain and burden: ‘Evermore wheresoeuer I be / The dred off deth do troble me’

Label: As I went on Yule day in our procession
_description: Joly Jankin — seven 3-line stanzas (aab) with kyrieleyson refrain and burden: ‘kyrie so kyrie / Iankyn syngyt merie / with aleyson’

Label: As I went out this ender day / Alone walking
Note: Ringler Jr. (1988) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 171; for burden cf. 3701.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, lament of;carols, of the Passion
_description: A Planctus Marie carol — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Alone alone alone alone / Sore I sygh and all for one’

Label: As long before prophesy said
_description: James Ryman, A song of the Nativity — eight quatrains (abab) and burden (cc): ‘A meyden myelde a chielde hath bore / Mankyende to blis forto restore’

Label: As the holly groweth green
Note: See Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 210.
_description: A Holly and Ivy carol turned into a love lyric, ascribed to Henry VIII — four cross-rhymed quatrains (abab) with a 4-line burden: ‘Grene growith the holy / So doth the iue / Thow wynter blastys blow neuer so hye / Grene growth the holy.’

Label: At a place where he me set
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 214; Ringler Jr. (1988) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988 TP 193.
_description: A carol of Hunting — three 5-line stanzas (aaabb) including refrain, ‘We shall have game and sport ynow’ plus burden: ‘As I walked by a forest side / I met with a foster he bad me abide’

Label: At Doomsday when we shall rise / And come before
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 215; stanza 1 = stanza 8 of 5797.
_description: A song of Doomsday — five quatrains (aaab) plus two-line burden (bb): ‘Mary moder I you pray / To be owr help at domys day’

Label: At the beginning of the meat
_description: A Boar’s Head carol — three quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Po po po po / Loue brane and so do mo’

Label: Auctor of health Christ have in mind
_description: James Ryman, A song of the Nativity — six quatrains (aabb) and burden (cc): ‘Nowe in this fest thy holy fest / Saluator mundi natus est’

Label: Be glad lordings both more and less
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) and Latin burden (cb): ‘Puer nobis natus est / De virgine Maria’

Label: Behold and see how that nature
Note: Burden used also for 887.
_description: James Ryman, A carol on the Miraculous Conception — nine quatrains (aaab) and burden (bbbc): ‘Ecce quod natura / mutat sua iura / Virgo parit pura / dei filium’

Label: Behold what life that we rine in
_description: Carol for the Feast of the Purification — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Reuertere reuertere / The quene of blysse & of beaute’

Label: Benign Lady blessed might Thou be
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 263; for a variant see 2043.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, songs in honour of;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: ‘De Sancta Maria’ — three 4-line stanzas (aaab) with refrain, ‘Regina celi letare’, and burden(bb): ‘Syng we to this mery company / Regina celi letare’

Label: Blessed be that maid Mary
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: Eya jhesus hodie / Natus est de uirgine

Label: Blessed must be our heaven Queen
Subjects: Virgin Mary, songs in honour of;carols, of women;women, praise of
_description: John Audelay, ‘De Virginitate’ — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘For the loue of a maydon fre / I haue me choson to chastite’

Label: Blessed must Thou be Thou bird so bright
_description: John Audelay, hymn ‘De sancta maria’ — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Heyle of wymmen flour of all / Thou herst vs when we to the call’

Label: Both young and old take heed of this
Note: See 794.
_description: James Ryman, a song — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Ecce quod natura /mutat sua iura / virgo parit pura / dei filium’

Label: Bought and sold full traitorously / And to a pillar bound
Subjects: Passion, carols of;Virgin Mary, sorrows of;carols, of the Passion
_description: A Song of the Passion — five quatrains (abab) and burden (cc): ‘To see the mayden wepe her sones passion / It entrid my hart full depe with gret compassion’

Label: By Thy birth Thou blessed Lord
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 301.
_description: A Song of the Nativity — two six-line stanzas (aabccb; aaabbc) with refrain, ‘Qui hodie natus es nobis’, and four-line burden: ‘Blessed mote ye be swete Ihesus / Qui hodie natus es nobis’ (repeated)

Label: Children of Eve both great and small
Subjects: Virgin Mary, songs in honour of;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: A hymn to the Virgin Mary in James Ryman’s songbook — six stanzas rhyme royal with refrain (ababbcc), ‘Maria spes nostra salue’, and burden (cc): ‘Mekely we syng and seye to the / Maria spes nostra salue’

Label: Christ cried in cradle moder ba ba / The children of Israel
Note: For a somewhat similar carol see 3422.
_description: ‘In die sanctorum Innocencium’ — six quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘With al the reuerens that we may / Worchip we childermas day’

Label: Christ keep us all as He well can / a solis ortus cardine
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 307.
_description: A macaronic carol of the Nativity — four quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Now syng we syng we / Gloria tibi domine’

Label: Come my dear spouse and lady free
_description: James Ryman, ‘Iam Veni Coronaberis’ — eight quatrains (abab) with this refrain and burden (bb): ‘Karissima in deliciis / Iam veni coronaberis’

Label: Conceived man how may that by reason brought about
Subjects: carols, of the Virgin’s motherhood;Incarnation, mystery of
_description: On the mystery of the Incarnation — five quatrains in long lines and two-line burden: ‘Mervell nothyng joseph that mary be with child / She hath conceyved vere god and man and yet she undefiled’

Label: Daily in England marvels be found
Subjects: women, against;carols, of marriage;carols, of marriage
_description: On the Tyranny of Women — nine stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘Nova noua sawe yow euer such / The most mayster of te hows weryth no brych’

Label: Death began because of sin
Note: Ringler Jr. (1988) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 339.
Subjects: transitoriness, of life;original sin;carols, of mortality
_description: We all must die — seven 8-line stanzas (ababcdcd) with ‘Forsothe all we shall dye’ refrain and 4-line burden: ‘Be thou poore or be thou ryche / I rede lyfte vp thyn eye / And se i this we be all lyche / Forsothe all we shall dye’

Label: Dic erodes impie
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 352.
Subjects: carols, of the Innocents;Holy Innocents, feast of
_description: A macaronic carol for Innocents’ Day — three 5-line stanzas (ababa) with refrain word, ‘milicia’, and 2-line burden: ‘Sonet laus per secula./ Innocentum gloria’

Label: Dievs wous garde byewsser tidings I you bring
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 354; cf. 1643.
_description: Welcome Sir Christmas — three 4-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Nowell’, and 7-line burden: ‘Nowell nowell nowell nowell / Who ys ther that syngeth so’

Label: Dread of death sorrow of sin
_description: John Audelay, ‘Timor mortis conturbat me’ — eleven quatrains (abab) including refrain, ‘passio christi conforta me’ and burden: ‘Lade helpe Ihesu merce / Timor mortis conturbat me’

Label: Every man in his degree
_description: ‘For few be trew to tryst vpon’ — eleven quatrains (aaab) with this refrain, and burden: ‘In a blyssefull tyme that mane ys borne / That may fynd frend to trust vpon’
Title(s): ‘For few be trew to tryst vpon’

Label: Exortum est in love and liss
_description: A Christmas carol with palindromic rhymes — five quatrains (aaab) with refrain and burden: ‘Nowel syng we bothe al and som / Now Rex Pacificus ys ycome’

Label: Fair maiden who is this bairn
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 395.
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: A carol of the Nativity — four quatrains (aabb) and four-line burden (aaaa): ‘Mater ora filium / Vt post hoc exilium / Nobis donet gaudium / Beatorum omnium’

Label: Father and Son and Holy Ghost / We knowledge Thee in every coast
_description: James Ryman, ‘Te deum verum laudamus’ — six quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘Te deum verum laudamus,’ and burden: ‘Alpha et o quem vocamus / Te deum verum laudamus’

Label: Father I am Thine own child
_description: Nolo mortem peccatoris — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Fadyr my wyll yt is / Nolo mortem peccatoris’

Label: Father of bliss omnipotent / For Thou hast made and create us
Subjects: carols, of the Trinity;Trinity, carols to
_description: James Ryman, ‘Te Deum laudamus’ — five quatrains (abab) including refrain (‘Te deum laudamus’) and burden: ‘Syng we alle thys tyme þus / Te deum laudamus’

Label: Feed the hunger the thirst give drink
Subjects: mercy, works of;carols, of religious counsel
_description: John Audelay, The Seven Works of Mercy — five 5-line stanzas (ababc) including ‘I cownsel þe’ refrain plus burden (cc): ‘Wele is him and wele schal be / That doth the vii werkis of merce’

Label: First largess my king my chief
_description: William Stewart, ‘Largess of this New Year Day’ — ten 5-line stanzas (aabab) and burden: ‘Lerges lerges lerges ay / Lerges of this new yeirday’

Label: For as ye list my will is bent
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 418; cf. Greene (1964) XGreene, Richard Leighton. “Wyatt’s ‘I am as I am’ in Carol-form.” Review of English Studies n.s. 15 (1964): 175-80, 178-9.
_description: ‘Even as ye lyst’, ascribed to Thomas Wyatt — seven 5-line stanzas (aaaab) with this refrain, and (1 MS only) 2-line burden: ‘As power and wytt wyll me assyst / My wyll shall wyll euyn as ye lyst’

Label: For His love that bought us all dear
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 421.
_description: A song of Christ the Fleur-de-lys — four quatrains including refrain, ‘can the flowr de lyce’ (aaab) plus burden (bb): ‘Synge we all for tyme it is / Mary hath born the flowre-de-lice’

Label: For love is love and ever shall be
_description: John Audelay, ‘De amore dei’, a carol — five 5-line stanzas (ababb) with refrain, ‘I say herefore’ and burden: ‘I haue a loue is heuen kyng / I loue his loue fore euermor’

Label: For on a Tuesday Thomas was born
Subjects: Thomas of Canterbury, saint;carols, of saints
_description: John Audelay, ‘De sancto Thome Archiepiscopo cantuariensis’, a carol — five quatrains (aaab) plus burden (bb): ‘I pra you sers al in fere / Worchip seynt thomas this hole marter’

Label: For pride in heart he hates all one
_description: John Audelay, ‘Cantalena de puericia’ — eight quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘And god wold graunt me my prayer / A child ayene I wold I were’

Label: Forsake thy pride and thine envy
_description: John Audelay, Song of the Seven Deadly Sins — five 5-line stanzas (ababc) including refrain, ‘I say þe so’, and burden (cc): ‘In wele be ware ore thou be woo / Thenke wens thou come wheder to goo’
Title(s): Song of the Seven Deadly Sins

Label: From heaven was sent an angel of light
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 448.
_description: A carol of the Annunciation — seven 5-line stanzas and burden: ‘Now we shuld syng and say newell / Quia missus est angelus Gabriel’

Label: Gabriel brighter than the sun
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 454.
_description: A New Year carol — three cross-rhymed quatrains (abab) plus four-line burden: ‘Make us meri this new yere / Thankyng god with hertely chere’

Label: Gabriel of high degree / Came down from the Trinity
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 455.
Subjects: carols, of the Annunciation;Virgin Mary, Annunciation to
_description: Annunciation carol — seven 4-line stanzas (aaab) including refrain, ‘With noua’, plus burden (bb): ‘Nova Nova / Ave fit ex Eva’

Label: Gabriel that angel bright
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 456.
_description: Annunciation carol — five quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘Regina celi letare,’ plus burden (bb): Now synge we syng we ‘Regina celi letare’

Label: Gallant pride thy father is dead
_description: A song of a merry gentleman — ten quatrains (aaab) and burden (?) repeated again at end: ‘Huff a galawnt vylabele / Thus syngeth galawntes in here revele’

Label: Game and earnest ever among
_description: Of Religious Duties — five quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Syng we to the Trinite / With parce mihi domine’

Label: Gaude maria Christs Mother
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 459.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, joys of;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: John Audelay, A hymn of the Five Joys — six 8-line stanzas with burden: ‘Aue maria now say we so / Moder & maydon was neuer non mo’
Title(s): A hymn of the Five Joys

Label: Gaude to whom Gabriel was sent
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 460.
_description: A song of the Five Joys — five quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Gawde for thy ioyes five / Mary moder maydyn & wyff’

Label: Gentle butler belle ami
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 462.
_description: Fill the Bowl, Butler — five 5-line stanzas (aaabb) including refrain and burden: ‘How butler how Bevis a towt / Fill the boll jentill butler & let the cup rowght’

Label: Get thee hence what doest thou here
Note: Ringler Jr. (1988) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988 TP 454; cf. 6737.
_description: Farewell to Advent — two quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Farewell aduent & haue good daye / Chrystmas is come nowe go thy way’.

Label: Glorious God had great pity
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 468.
_description: A Christmas carol — six 7-line stanzas (aaabccb) plus burden: ‘Synge we with myrth ioye and solas / In honowr of this cristemas’

Label: Glorious God in Trinity
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 469.
_description: A carol to Christ, with refrain, ‘Miserere mei’ — three 5-line stanzas (aaaaa) plus burden: ‘Ihesu fili dei / Miserere mei’

Label: God against nature three wonders hath wrought
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 476.
_description: A theological carol about the Incarnation — seven 9-line stanzas plus burden: ‘By reason of two & poore of one / This tyme god & man was set at one’

Label: God send us peace and unity / In England with prosperity
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 488.
_description: ‘Do well & drede no man’ — four 6-line stanzas with this refrain plus burden: ‘The beste rede that I can / Do well and drede no man’

Label: God that all this world has wrought
_description: A carol to Christ against dangers and temptations — four quatrains and burden: ‘Now jhesus rector anime / Ne cademus sustine’

Label: Gods Son for the love of man
_description: A Christmas carol — four quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘Make we mery in this fest / For verbum caro factum est’

Label: Gods Son is born
_description: A song of the Nativity — five 9-line stanzas (ababcdddc) and 4-line burden: ‘Blyssid be that lady bryght / That bare a chyld off great myght / Withoute peyne as it ws right / Mayd mother marye’

Label: Good day Sir Christmas our King / for every man
Note: For another ‘Sir Christmas’ carol see 2218.
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) with ‘Good day’ refrain and burden: ‘Go day go day / My lord syre cristemasse go day’

Label: Good sir pray I thee
_description: An early fragmentary carol — one quatrain (aaab) and burden: ‘Icham of Irlaunde / Ant of the holy londe / Of Irlande’

Label: Guile and gold together arn met
_description: Of covetous guile — five quatrains and burden: ‘Now go gyle gyle gyle / Now go gile gyle go’

Label: Hail be Thou Mary most of honour
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;hymns to Virgin Mary
_description: To the Virgin — four quatrains (aabb) with ‘Aue plena gracia’ refrain and burden: ‘Ave, plena gracia / Dei mater Maria’

Label: Hail blessed Lady which has born / God Son
_description: Hymn to the Virgin — one irregular quatrain

Label: Hail full of grace Christ is with thee
Subjects: hymns to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, A hymn to the Virgin Mary — five quatrains (aaab) with alternating refrains which are joined in the burden: ‘Aue regina celorum / Flos et decus beatorum’

Label: Hail full of grace Christ is with thee
_description: James Ryman, A hymn on the Angelic Salutation — ten quatrains (abab) with alternating refrains all ending ‘Emanuel’, and four-line burden: ‘Nowel nowel nowel nowel / Nowel nowel nowel nowel / Inquit marie gabriel / concipies emanuel’

Label: Hail most mighty in Thy working
_description: Aue Rex anglorum: an Epiphany carol — one quatrain (aaab) and burden: ‘Aue rex angelorum / Aue rexque celorum / Aue princepsque polorum’

Label: Hail our lode star both bright and clear
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;hymns to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, ‘Salue regina glorie / Mater misericordie’ — twelve quatrains (abab) with this burden

Label: Have mind for thee how I was born
Subjects: Christ, appeal of, to man;carols, of Christ’s pleading
_description: James Ryman, Appeal of Christ to Man — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Hec sunt verba saluatoris / Nolo mortem peccatoris’

Label: Have mind how I mankind have take
Subjects: carols, of Christ’s pleading;Christ, appeal of, to man
_description: James Ryman, Appeal of Christ to Man — ten quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘O synfull man yeue me thyn hert’ and burden: ‘Reuert reuert reuert reuert / O synfull man geve me thyn hert’

Label: He bore him up he bore him down
Note: Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 530.
_description: A Corpus Christi carol — six couplets and burden: ‘Lulley lulley lulley lulley / The fawcon hath born my mak away’

Label: He that smiteth with a stave of oak
_description: Medius part of a carol or refrain-song, with refrain, ‘Card lye down & whele stond styll / lett [ ] / [ ] tyll peny pot to þe nale tryll’ — fragment

Label: Here comes Holly that is so gent
_description: In praise of holly — four couplets, ‘Alleluia’ refrain, and burden: Alleluia, alleluia / Alleluia now syng we’

Label: Here have I dwelled with more and less
_description: Farewell to Christmas — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Now haue gud day now haue gud day / I am crystmas and now I go my way’

Label: Herod that was both wild and wood
_description: A carol for Innocents’ Day — four quatrains and four-line burden: ‘Worcepe we this holy day / That all innocentis for vs pray’ (repeated)

Label: His body is wapped all in woe / Hand and foot he may not go
Note: For an earlier version in couplets see 3326, 3959, etc.; for other versions in quatrains see 3424 and 5653; for Kele’s version see 3424.
_description: A song of the Passion — eight quatrains and burden: ‘Mary modyr cum and se / Thi son is naylyd on a tre’

Label: His sign is a star birth
_description: An Epiphany carol — three quatrains (aaab) with ‘Iluminare Jerusalem’ refrain and burden: ‘Illuminare jherusalem / The duke aperyth in bedlem’

Label: Holly and Ivy made a great party [Holver and Heivy made a grete party]
_description: Holly and Ivy — four 3-line stanzas

Label: Holly beareth berries red enough
_description: Holly against Ivy — four monorhyming quatrains and burden: ‘Nay nay ive it may not be iwis / For holy must haue the mastry as the maner is’

Label: Holy Maiden blessed Thou be / Gods son is born of Thee
Note: For a variant see 823.
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;hymns to Virgin Mary
_description: A song in praise of the Virgin Mary — seven quatrains (aaaa) with refrain ‘Regina celi letare’, and burden: ‘Synge we to this mery cumpane / Regina celi letare’

Label: Holy Writ sayeth which no thing is soother
_description: ‘Amende me and peyre me nauȝt’ — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘I pray yow all wyth o thowght / Amende me and peyre me nowght’

Label: How should I but I thought on my ending day
Note: For a variant see 2098.
_description: A song of admonition — five 6-line stanzas (aaaabb) and burden: ‘Thynk we on our endyng I red I red I red / Thynk we on our endyng I red or we [gon]’

Label: How should I now thou fair may fall upon a sleep
Subjects: carols, lullaby;Virgin Mary, dialogue, with Christ;dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: Dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Child — four 12-line stanzas with refrain, ‘It is my fader wyll’ and 4-line burden: ‘Lullay lullay my lityl chyld / Slepe & be now styll / If thou be a lytill chyld / Yitt may thou haue thi wyll’

Label: How should I with that old man
Note: Utley (1944) XUtley, Francis Lee. The Crooked Rib. Ohio State Contributions in Language and Literature 10. Columbus, OH: Ohio State UP, 1944, 18.
_description: A fragment of a love song, reconstructed as the first English carol — perhaps one 5-line stanza (aabba) (cf. Greene (1952) XGreene, Richard Leighton. “‘The Maid of the Moor’ in the Red Book of Ossory.” Speculum 27 (1952): 504-6, 506) and burden: ‘Alas hou shold y synge / Yloren is my playnge’

Label: I am a child and born full bare / And bare out of this world shall fare
Note: For a variant see 2088.
_description: ‘When I think on my Ending Day’ — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘I drukke I dare so wil I may / Quan I thynke on myn endyng day’
Title(s): ‘When I think on my Ending Day’

Label: I am as I am and so I will be
Note: Cf. Utley (1945) XUtley, Francis Lee. “Wyatt as a Scottish Poet.” Modern Language Notes 60 (1945): 106-11, 106-10.
_description: The rebellious lover, attributed to Sir Thomas Wyatt — 10 monorhyming quatrains

Label: I am sorry for her sake
Note: For a similar burden cf. 371.
_description: A Lover’s sad plight — three quatrains (abab) and 4-line burden: ‘Care away, away, away / Murnynge away / Y am forsake another ys take / No more murne yc may’

Label: I have I-sought in many a side
_description: A song of the well of Mercy — three quatrains and 4-line burden: ‘To many a will haue y go / To fynde water to washe me fro woo’ (repeated)

Label: I Joseph wonder how this may be
Note: First and fifth lines to be repeated in singing, and written thus, st. 1.
_description: Joseph’s Trouble about Mary — four 5-line stanzas (aaaab) and four-line burden: ‘Meruele noght Josep on Mary mylde / Forsake hyr not tho she be with childe’ (repeated)

Label: I love a flower of sweet odor
Note: Variant forms of burden written after stanzas 4, 6.
_description: The Tudor Rose — six 5-line stanzas (aaabb) and a five-line burden: ‘I loue I loue and wom loue ye / I loue a floure of fressh beaute / I loue another as well as ye / Than shal beprovid here anon / Yff we iii can agre in on’, with music by Sir Thomas Phelipps

Label: I loved a child of this country
_description: A Forsaken Maiden’s Lament — three quatrains with ‘For he is far’ refrain and burden: ‘Were it vndo that is ydo / I wold be war’

Label: I never saw joy like to that sight
Note: Formerly 2232.
_description: A description of his mistress — three quatrains (abab) and 4-line burden: ‘My dere an dese þat so fayr ys / Of lufe gentyl & fre / I kwn not ly, wiþowtyn lese / My lady lele best lyks me’

Label: I pray you maidens everyone
_description: An erotic carol with double entendre — six quatrains (aabb) and burden: ‘Podynges at nyght & podynges at none / Were nat for podynges the world were clene done’

Label: I pray you sirs both more and less
_description: Introduction to a series of Christmas carols — one couplet

Label: I saw a dog seething souse
_description: A nonsense carol of ‘tall stories’ — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Hay hey hey hey / I will haue the whetston and I may’

Label: I saw a fair maiden sitten and sing
_description: Cradle song of the Virgin Mary — five couplets and burden: ‘Lullay myn lykyng my dere sone myn swetyng / Lullay my dere herte myn owyn dere derlyng’

Label: I saw a sweet seemly sight
_description: The Virgin’s Lullaby — one 6-line stanza (aabccb) and 5-line burden: ‘Lullay lullow lully lullay / Bewy bewy lully lully / Bewy lully lullow lully / Lullay baw baw my barne / Slepe softly now’

Label: I shall you tell a full good sport
Note: For a version in quatrains cf. 3795.
_description: The Gossips’ Meeting — twenty-five 6-line stanzas (aaabbc) with ‘Good gossips myn’ refrain and burden: ‘Hoow gossip myne gossip myn / Whan will we go to the wyne / Good gossipes [myn]’

Label: I shall you tell a great marvel / How an angel for our avail
_description: A song of the Annunciation — six 3-line stanzas (aaa) and burden: ̴What hard ye not the kyng of Jherusalem / Is now bor in Bethelem’

Label: I shall you tell this ilk night
_description: A carol to St. Stephen — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘The holy marter Steuen we pray / To be our socour both myght and day’

Label: I warn you everyone for ye should understand
Note: Cf. Ransome (1889) XRansome, Cyril. “The Battle of Towton.” English Historical Review 4 (1889): 460-6, 460.
_description: The Rose of Rouen, a political carol on the Battle of Towton, Yorkshire (1461) — fifteen 5-line stanzas (aaaab) with refrain, ‘Blessid be þe tyme þat euer god sprad þat floure’ and burden: ‘Now is the rose of rone growen to a gret honoure / Therfore syng we euerychone I blessid be that floure’

Label: I was with pope and cardinal
_description: Well is he that has enough and can say, ‘Whoa!’ — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Forsothe I hold hym well and withowt woo / That hath ynowgh and can say whoo’

Label: I wot a bird in bower bright / That fully seemly is on sight
_description: The loveliest lady in the land — ten 8-line stanzas (aaabcccb) and 4-line burden: ‘Blow northerne wynd / sent þou me my suetyng / blow norþerne wynd / blou blou blou’.

Label: I would fain be a clerk / But yet it is a strange work
_description: The Schoolboy’s Lament — six 5-line stanzas (aaaab) with refrain, ‘What avaylith it me thowgh I say nay’, and burden: ‘Hay hay by this day / What avayleth it me thowgh I say nay’

Label: If I held the low assize
_description: Politic counsels — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Lord how scholde I roule me / Of al men I preysyd to be’

Label: If thou serve a lord of price / Be not too boistous…
Note: The same refrain occurs also in 2441; see also 4208.
_description: ‘Seruyse is non erytage’ — four quatrains (aaab) with this refrain and burden: ‘Bewar sqwyer yeman & page / For seruyse is non erytage’

Label: If thou thy life in sin have led
_description: James Ryman, An exhortation to repentance — five quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘Of a synner he wille no deth’ and burden: ‘Thus seith Ihesu of nazareth / Of a synner I wille noo deth’

Label: Illa iuventus that is so nice / Me deduxit in to vain devise
_description: A macaronic carol of five quatrains and refrain: ‘Terribilis mors conturbat me’

Label: In a glorious garden green / Saw I sitting a comely queen
_description: The White Rose; a political carol on Elizabeth, wife of Henry VII — two 7-line stanzas (aaaabbc) and 4-line repeated burden: ‘This day day dawes / This gentill day day dawes / this gentill day dawes / & I must home gone’

Label: In all this world nis a merrier life
_description: On the Joys of being a bachelor — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: A, a, a, a, yet I love wherso I go

Label: In Bethlehem that fair city
_description: A Christmas carol — four quatrains each ending with a Latin line, and burden: ‘To blys God bryng vs al & sum / Christe redemptor omnium’

Label: In Bethlehem this bird of life
_description: A Christmas carol — five 6-line stanzas (aaabab) and burden: ‘Nowel nowel nowel / To vs is born owr god emanuel’

Label: In every place where that I wend / My purse is my own friend
_description: ‘Gremercy Mine own Purse’ — five quatrains (aaab) with this refrain and burden: ‘I may syng & sey iwys / Gremercy my owne [purse]’

Label: In every place ye may well see
_description: The excellence (or not!) of women — ten quatrains (aaaa) with burden: ‘Of all creatures women be best / Cuius contrarium verum est’

Label: In heaven there sit a lady…
Note: Fragment only, missing ends of lines; for similar pieces see 4826 and 6781
_description: In praise of women — five 3-line stanzas and burden: Women ben good for lo[ve] / …that sit above

Label: In Patras there born he was
_description: A song of St. Nicholas — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Mak ye merie as ye may / & syng with me I you pray’

Label: In prophecy thus it is said
_description: James Ryman, The prophecy of Simeon — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Mary so myelde alone / For her chielde made grete mone’

Label: In the beginning of this year
_description: A New Year Carol — one quatrain (aabb) and burden: ‘nay mary I nay maye mary / I peter but ye must / nay mary I’

Label: In this time a child was born
Note: Burden same as 2641; for a variant see 5700.
Subjects: Christ, songs in honour of;carols, Nativity
_description: A song of the six festivals in honor of Christ: Nativity, Circumcision, etc. — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ’Man be glad in halle & bour / This tyme was born our sauyour’

Label: In this time Christ hath us sent
Note: Burden same as 2640.
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Make we mery in hall & bowr / Thys tyme was born owr savyower’

Label: In this time of Christmas
_description: Mary plays with the Christ Child, a carol — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘In the honour of christes byrth / Syng we al with joye and myrthe’

Label: In this vale of wretchedness
_description: Song for St. Stephen’s Day — four quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and four-line burden: ‘Pray for vs that we saued be / Prothomartir Stephane’ (repeated)

Label: In what order or what degree
_description: John Audelay, ‘ffac ad quod venisti’, — eight 5-line stanzas(ababc) with ‘I say algate’ refrain and burden: ‘Hit is the best erele & late / Vche mon kepe his oune state’

Label: In word in deed in will in thought
_description: John Audelay, ‘Cantalena de virginibus’ — eight quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘I pray youe maydys that here be / Kepe your state & your degre’

Label: Into this world this day did come
_description: A song of the Nativity — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘I pray you be mery & synge with me / In worship of cristys nativite’

Label: Ipse mocat me
_description: A nonsense carol — four 3-line macaronic stanzas (aab) including In ciuitate Dauid refrain and 2-line burden: ‘Gebit gebit gebit gebit / Lux fulgebit hodie’

Label: Is there any good man here
_description: A Minstrel’s Greeting — six 8-line stanzas (aaabcccb) and 3-line burden: ‘Bon jowre bon jowre a vous / I am cum vnto this hows / Vith par la pompe I say’

Label: It fell against the next night
_description: The Fox and the Goose — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Pax uobis quod the fox / ffor I am comyn to toowne’

Label: It is bread from heaven come / Flesh & blood of Mary it nam
_description: A Song in honour of the Eucharist — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Worchyp we bothe more & lesce / Crystes body in furme of bred’

Label: It is full heavy chastity
_description: John Audelay, ‘De matrimonio mulierum’ — seven 5-line stanzas (ababc) with ‘All day thou seest’ refrain and burden: ‘Avyse youe wemen wom ye trust / & beware of had i wys’

Label: It is known in every shire
Subjects: tongue, destructive power of;carols, of moral counsel
_description: On the evil wrought by ‘wekyd tongges’ — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘A man that con his tong stere / He ther not rek wer that he go’

Label: It was a maid of brenten arse
_description: ‘My ladyes water-myll’: an erotic carol — four 3-line stanzas (aaa) and burden: ‘Synge dyllum dyllum dyllum dyllum / I can tell you and I wyll / Of my ladyes water-myll’

Label: It wern four letters of purpose I / of M and A R and I
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;hymns to Virgin Mary
_description: A song in praise of the Virgin Mary — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘M & A & R & I / Syngyn I wyl a newe song’

Label: Ivy is both fair and green
_description: A carol in praise of ivy — five 7-line stanzas (ababccc) including bob and burden: ‘Ivy ys good & glad to se / Iuy is fair in hys degre’

Label: Jesu as Thou art our savior
_description: A song to Christ — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Jhesu jhesu jhesu jhesu / Saf vs alle thorw thi vertu’

Label: Jesu for thy holy name
Note: Burden based on the first stanza of 2840.
_description: A Litany to Christ, the Virgin Mary, Angels and Saints — nine 6-line stanzas (ababcc) with refrain, ‘And bryng us to that blysse / That neuere shall mysse’, and 4-line burden: ‘Prey we to the trinyte / And to al the holy compane / For to bryng vs to the blys / The wych shal neuer mysse’
Title(s): A Litany to Christ, the Virgin Mary, Angels and Saints

Label: Jesu for Thy wounds five
_description: Pray for Peace (c. 1499) — one stanza (ababcc) with four-line burden: ‘Jhesu for thy mercy endelesse / Saue thy pepill and sende vs pesse (repeated), ten lines in all’

Label: Jesu of a maid Thou wouldest be born
Note: Stanzas 1 and 4 similar to lines 1-4 of 5079.
_description: A song of Jesus the Saviour — five quatrains (aabb) with ‘Miserere nobis’ refrain and four-line burden: ‘Iesu fili virginis / miserere nobis’ (repeated)

Label: Jesu of His mother was born
_description: ‘Verbum caro factum est’ — six quatrains (aaab) with ‘He tok his deth for most & lest’ refrain and burden: ‘I may seyn to most & lest / Verbum caro factum est’

Label: Jesu rested in a may / Forty weeks and a day
_description: A Christmas carol — three quatrains (aaab) with ‘Nowell ell ell’ refrain and burden: ‘Nowell nowell ell ell / Iwys yt ys a wunder nowell’

Label: Jesu was born in Bethlehem Iudea / Of maid Mary thus find we
_description: A carol for Epiphany — eleven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘The sterre hym schon bothe nyght & day / To lede thre kynges ther our lord lay’

Label: John Clerk of Torrington I dare avow
_description: Against John Clerke of Torrington, an English flyting — six cross-rhymed quatrains and a single six-line stanza, with burden: ‘Synge and blow, blow wel blow / Synge wen so Y blow’

Label: Joseph would have fled fro that maid
_description: James Ryman, On the appearance of the Angel to Joseph — six stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘Awake joseph awake awake / And to marie thy way thou take’

Label: Kitt she wept I asked why so
Note: For a later sequel, cf. Collier (1853) XCollier, John Payne. Extracts from Registers of the Stationers’ Company: from 1457 to 1587. London: for the Shakespeare Society, 1853, 1.55; Tilley (1950) XTilley, Morris Palmer. A Dictionary of the Proverbs in England in the 16th and 17th Centuries. Ann Arbor, MI: University of Michigan, 1950 K 109. Formerly indexed at same location by burden.
_description: An erotic carol — five quatrains and ten-line burden: ‘Kytt hathe lost hur key hur key / Goode Kytt hath lost hure key / She ys soo sory for the cause / She wottes nott what to say / She ys soo sory fore the cause / She wott not what to say to say / Goode Kytt good Kytt / She ys soo sory for the cause / She wot not [what] to say to say / Good Kytt’

Label: Led I the dance a midsummer day
_description: Jack and the Dancing Maid, an erotic carol — nine 5-line stanzas (aaaab) and burden: ‘Alas ales the wyle / Thout Y on no gyle / So haue Y god chaunce / Alas ales the wyle / That euer Y cowde daunce’

Label: Let no man come into this hall
_description: A carol of Christmas sports — three quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Make we mery bothe more & lasse / ffor now ys þe tyme of crystymas’

Label: Lift up your hearts and be glad / In Christs birth the angel bade
_description: A New Year song of Good Cheer — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘What cher gud cher gud cher / Be mery & glad this gud new yere’

Label: Listen lordings what I shall say
Subjects: Katherine of Alexandria, saint;carols, of saints
_description: A song in honour of St. Katherine — five quatrains (aaab) with ‘Salue Caterina’ refrain and burden: A a a a / Salue Caterri[n]a

Label: Listeneth lordings both great and small
Subjects: Thomas of Canterbury, saint;carols, of saints
_description: Song in honour of St. Thomas of Canterbury — in quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and burden: A a a a / Nu[nc] gaudet ecclesia

Label: Listeneth lordings both elde and young
Note: For a variant see 3128
_description: A carol of the Nativity — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Of a rose a louely rose / Of a rose is al myn song’

Label: Listeneth lordings I you beseek
_description: The Braggart and his Baselard — eight quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Prenegard prenegard / þus bere I myn baselard’

Label: Lithe and listen both old and young
Note: For a variant see 3114
_description: A carol of the Nativity — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Of a rose a louely rose / Of a rose I syng a song’

Label: Lo Moses bush shining unbrent
Subjects: carols, of Virgin Mary;Virgin Mary, types of
_description: Types of the Virgin Mary: Burning bush, Gideon’s fleece, Aaron’s rod, Star of Jacob — a song of five quatrains (aaab) and 3-line burden: ‘Hayl godys sone in trinite / Te secund in diuinite / Thy moder is a may’

Label: Look ere thine heart be set / Look thou woo ere thou be knit
_description: A song against marrying unadvisedly — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Man bewar of thin wowyng / For weddyng is the longe wo’

Label: Lords and ladies all bedene
_description: ‘A new caroll of our lady’ — eight quatrains (abab) and 2-line burden: ‘Nowell nowell nowell nowell / This sayd the aungell gabryell’

Label: Love is natural to every wight
_description: One mistress is best — three 5-line stanzas (ababc) with 4-line burden: ‘Smale pathis to the grenewode / Will I loue & shall I loue / Will I loue & shall I loue / No mo maydyns but one’

Label: Lullay lullay little child
_description: Christ weeps in the cradle for man’s sin — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Lullay lullay litel child / qwi wepest þou so sore’

Label: Maiden and mother come and see / Thy child is nailed to a tree
Note: For later versions, in stanzas, see 2029, 3424 and 5653.
Subjects: carols, of the Passion;Virgin Mary, dialogue, with Christ;dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: A dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her son — eighteen couplets in John Grimestone’s sermon notebook

Label: Make we merry in hall and bower
_description: A carol on the Circumcision — six quatrains (abab) with Latin caudae and burden: ‘To encrease our joy and blysse / Christus natus est nobis’

Label: Man and woman in every place
_description: ‘Thank God that al hath sent’ — five quatrains (aaab) with this refrain, and burden: ‘Lefte owr hertes wiþ good entent / & thanke [g]od þat al hath sen’

Label: Man be merry I thee rede
_description: A Nativity carol — three quatrains (abab) and 4-line burden: ‘Man be joyfull & myrth þou make / For crist ys made man for thy sake’ (repeated)

Label: Man beware the way is slither
Note: See also 3356; the first stanza is almost identical with stanza 4 of 5891.
_description: Against false executors — four quatrains (aaab) with the refrain: ‘Lytyll ioye ys son done’, and burden: ‘Haue in mynd in mynd in mynd / Secuters be oft onekynd’

Label: Man have in mind how here before
_description: Of Divine Mercy — six quatrains (aaab) + burden (bb): ‘Aske þou mercy whill þou may’, and burden (bb): ‘Man assay assay assay / and aske mercy quyls þat þu may’

Label: Man that in earth abides here
Subjects: Eucharist, Christ’s presence in;carols, of the Eucharist
_description: A song of the Host — three five-line stanzas with refrain ‘Mirabile’, plus burden (bb): ‘Mirabile misterium / In forme of bred ys Godis son’

Label: Mankind I call which lyeth in frail
Note: Var. burden in London, British Library Royal Appendix 58, f. 8v; cf. 5066.
Subjects: Christ, appeal of, to man;carols, of Christ’s pleading
_description: Christ’s Call to Mankind — seven 4-line stanzas (abcb) and 6-line burden: ‘Com home agayne / Com home agayne / Min owine swet hart com home agayne / Ye are gone astray / Owt of youer way / There[fore] com h[o]me agayne’

Label: Mankind was shent and ay forlore
_description: A song of the Nativity, by James Ryman — six quatrains (aaab) with ‘In clennes and in charite’ refrain and burden: ‘To criste singe we singe we singe we / In clennes and in charite’

Label: Many a man blames his wife pardie
_description: Women will have their word — fourteen quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘In villa’ plus burden (b): ‘In villa In villa quid vidistis in villa’

Label: Mary flower of flowers all
_description: A Christmas carol — seven quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘Puer natus est nobis’, plus burden: ‘Now syng we wyth joy and blys / Puer natus est nobis’

Label: Mary for the love of thee / Glad and merry shall we be
Subjects: Virgin Mary, joys of;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: On the Five Joys — seven quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘A a a a / Gaude celi domina’

Label: Mary is a lady bright / She hath a son of much might
_description: Carol on the Virgin — five quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and burden: A a a a / Nu[nc] gaudet maria

Label: Mary mild hath born a child / christ lieth in cradle bound
_description: A carol of the Feasts following Christmas — in quatrains (abcb), and burden: ‘Now this yol &c.’

Label: Mary mother come and see / Thy son is nailed on a tree
Note: For an earlier version in couplets see 3326; for later stanzaic versions see 2029 and 5653, where this incipit serves as the burden.
Subjects: carols, of the Passion;Passion;dialogues, Virgin and Christ
_description: Song of the Passion — seven quatrains (aabb, aaaa) and burden: ‘Nowel el…’

Label: Mary mother meek and mild
_description: A macaronic song of the Five Joys — five quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and ‘Nowel’ burden: ‘Nowel el el el el el el el el el el / Mary was gret with gabriel’

Label: Mary so mild and good of fame
_description: A hymn to the Virgin Mary by James Ryman — seven quatrains (abab) and burden (cc): ‘Mary so myelde of hert & myende / Hath borne a child to save mankyende’

Label: Merry singen the monks binnen Ely
_description: The Canute Song, quoted by Thomas of Ely — two couplets

Label: Mind reason virtue and grace
Subjects: carols, of religious counsel;Holy Ghost, gifts of
_description: A song of the Seven Gifts of the Holy Ghost, by Audelay — six 5-line stanzas (ababc) with ‘Ellis were we lost’ refrain and burden: ‘God haþ ȝeuen of myȝtis most / The vii ȝiftis of the hole gost’

Label: Mine own dear lady fair and free / I pray you in heart…
_description: A Lover’s Plea — three quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Thei Y singe & murthes make / It is not Y wolde’

Label: Most sovereign Lord Christ Jesu
_description: ‘Miserere nobis’: a carol to Christ — five 5-line stanzas (aaabb) with ‘Miserere nobis‘ refrain and burden: ‘Jesu christe fili dei viui mise[rere no]bis / Alleluya’

Label: My darling dear my daisy flower
_description: The lover deceived, by John Skelton — four stanzas rime royal with couplet heading: ‘With lullay lullay like a childe / Thou slepest too long thou art begiled.’ (Utley (1944) XUtley, Francis Lee. The Crooked Rib. Ohio State Contributions in Language and Literature 10. Columbus, OH: Ohio State UP, 1944, 192; Ringler Jr. (1988) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988, TP 1154).

Label: My lady went to Canterbury
Note: Cf. Ravenscroft (1609) XRavenscroft, Thomas. Pammelia Mysicks Miscellanie. London: Barley, 1609.
_description: A nonsense carol — eight quatrains (abab) and 4-line burden: ‘My harte of golde as true as stele / As I me lened to a bough / In fayth but yf ye loue me well / Lorde so robyn lough’

Label: My sovereign lord for my poor sake
Note: See Greene (1977) XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977 (see also Greene (1935) XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977), 487; see Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1070.
Subjects: tournaments;Henry VIII;carols, amorous;women, as speakers/narrators;Catherine of Aragon
_description: William Cornish, A lady (probably Catherine of Aragon) rejoices at her lover in a chivalric tournament, probably with reference to Henry VIII — six 6-line stanzas (aaabbc) with burden: ‘Whilles lyue or breth is in my brest / My souerayne lord I shall loue best’

Label: My years be young even as ye see
_description: A girl’s expression of love by Thomas Wyatt — six 5-line stanzas (aaaab) including refrain: ‘Yf yt ware not’, and 2-line burden: ‘Grudge on who liste this ys my lott / Nothing to want if it ware not’

Label: Now for to sing I hold it best
_description: James Ryman, a Christmas carol — six quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Nowe lete us syng and mery be / ffor crist oure kyng haþe made us fre’

Label: Now God almighty down hath sent
_description: A Christmas carol — three monorhyming quatrains plus 7-line burden (aabbccb, of which apparently only last five lines repeated after the quatrains): ‘Now make we merthe al & sum / ffor cristemesse now is i-com / þat hath no pere / Syng we alle in fere / Now ioye & blysse / þei xul not mysse / þat makyth good chere’

Label: Now in Bethlehem that holy place
_description: James Ryman, ‘Saluator mundi natus est’ — nine quatrains (aaab) including refrain, ‘Saluator mundi natus est’, plus burden: ‘Be we mery now in this fest / In quo saluator natus est’

Label: Now is Christmas I-come
Note: For a closely related version see 3769.
_description: An Epiphany carol — twelve 5-line stanzas (aaabb, lacks burden)

Label: Now is come our Savior / And now hathe Mary borne
_description: Carol for the Festivals following Christmas — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Welcum welcum welcum / Christe redemptor omneum’

Label: Now is the twelfth day I-come
Note: For a closely-related version see 3763.
_description: An Epiphany carol — seventeen 5-line stanzas (aaabb), and burden: ‘Reges de saba venient / Aurum tus myrram offerent’

Label: Now is Yule comen with gentle cheer
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab, same rhymes throughout) and burden: ‘Hay ay hay ay / Make we mere as we may’

Label: Now joy be to the Trinity / Father Son and Holy Ghost
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Wassaill wassayll wassaill syng we / In worshipe of cristes natiuite’
Bibliographic Ghosts: London, British Library Harley 1288, f. 120: this item does not appear in the MS, which has only 105 folios.

Label: Now shall you hear a tale for your disport
Note: For a version in 6-line stanzas see 2274.
_description: The Gossips’ Meeting — in eight-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Gode gosyp’, after fourth and eighth

Label: Now she that I / Loved truly…
_description: Three quatrains with refrain ‘…a way morning away / I am forsake / Another ys take / no lenger…’

Label: Now this time rex pacificus
_description: James Ryman, an Epiphany carol — six quatrains (aaab), including refrain, ‘The sonne of god & king of blis’, plus burden: ‘Of a mayden to vs borne is / the sonne of god and king of blis’

Label: Now well may me mirths make
_description: A macaronic Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) with Latin caudae and burden (b): Letabundus exultet fidelys chorus Alleluia

Label: Nowell ell both elde and young
_description: A Christmas carol — eight quatrains (aaab) and ‘Nowel el’ burden

Label: O blessed God in Trinity
_description: ‘Te Deum Laudamus’, a Christmas carol — three 5-line stanzas (ababc) with this refrain and 3-line burden: ‘T[e deum] laudamus / Te dominum confitemur / Te eternum’

Label: O blessed John the Evangelist
Subjects: John the Evangelist, saint;carols, to saints
_description: A carol to St. John — five quatrains (aaab) and 2-line burden: ‘Pray for vs to god on hye / Blyssed saynt johan and our lady’

Label: O blissful bird full of grace
Subjects: Virgin Mary, prayers to;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: ‘Salue regina / mater misericordie’ — six quatrains with Salue refrain and this burden

Label: O man of mould
Note: For a variant see 469.
_description: James Ryman, a song of the Annunciation — seven 4-line stanzas (abab) and 4-line burden: ‘A meyden mylde hath born a chylde / Mankynde ayene to by / Hys name ihesu ys callyd thus / And here name mylde mary’

Label: O merciful God maker of all mankind
_description: An epitaph — two 6-line stanzas (aabaab) and burden (cc): ‘To dy to dy what haue I / offendit þat deth is so hasty’

Label: O most famous noble king thy fame doth spring and spread
Subjects: Henry VII;Garter, Order of;occasional verse;carols, political;political poems
_description: John Skelton[?]. Verses presented to Henry VII (in 1488) by Skelton — five stanzas rhyme royal including refrain, ‘To see thy king so flowring in dignytie’ with burden: ‘England, now rejoysse, for joyous may thou bee / To see thy king so flowring in dignytie’

Label: O my dear Son why dost Thou so
Subjects: dialogues, Virgin and Christ;Virgin Mary, dialogue, with Christ;carols, of the Passion
_description: James Ryman, dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Son on the Cross — eight stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘O synfull man behold & se / What thy maker hath done for the’

Label: O of Jesse thou holy root
_description: Song ‘0 radix Iesse’ — three quatrains and 8-line Latin burden: ‘O radix iesse supplices / Te nos inuocamus / Veni vt nos liberes / Quem iam expectamus’ (repeated)

Label: O orient light shining most bright
Subjects: carols, to Christ;Christ, songs in honour of
_description: James Ryman, ‘O criste rex gencium’ — eight quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘O criste rex gencium / O vita viuencium’

Label: O princess of eternal peace
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, A hymn to the Virgin Mary — three stanzas rhyme royal with refrain: ‘Mater misericordie’, and burden: ‘Maria mater gracie / Mater misericordie’

Label: O Queen of bliss thy son Jesu
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to the Virgin Mary — ten quatrains (abab) with alternating refrains, ‘Regina celi letare’ and ‘Quem meruisti portare’, and 2-line burden (bb): ‘Stella celi micaris clare / Regina celi letare’

Label: O Queen of grace and of comfort
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to the Virgin Mary — seven quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘O mater ora filium’ and burden: ‘To heuyn blis that we may come / O mater ora filium’

Label: O queen of mercy and of grace
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to the Virgin Mary — twelve quatrains (aaab) with alternating refrains: ‘O clemens o pia’ and ‘O dulcis Maria’, which are joined in the burden

Label: O queen of pity and of grace
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to the Virgin Mary — eight stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘O quene of pitee moder of grace / In the high citee graunt vs a place’

Label: O sisters two
_description: The Coventry Carol — three 6-line stanzas (aabccb) with burden: ‘Lully lulla þow littell tine child / By by lully lullay thow littell tyne child / By by lullay lullay’, occurring in the Coventry Pageant of Shearmen and Tailors

Label: O spousess most dear most bright most clear
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, an orison to the Virgin Mary — three quatrains (aabb) with refrain, ‘Ora pro nobis’ and burden (b): ‘Sancta maria ora pro nobis’

Label: O spousess of Christ and paramour
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, an orison to the Virgin Mary — five quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘Ora pro nobis’ and burden: ‘Sancta maria ora pro nobis’

Label: O strong Judith so full of might
Note: For a variant of stanzas 2, 3, 8, see 3940, stanzas 4-6.
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, ‘Mater misericordie’ — eight quatrains (abab) including refrain, ‘Mater misericordie,’ and burden (bb): ‘Salue regina glorie / Mater misericordie’

Label: O sweet Jesu so meek and mild / Fili Marie virginis
_description: James Ryman, ‘Succurre nobis miseris’, a macaronic hymn to Christ — five quatrains (abab) including refrain, ‘Succure nobis miseris’ and burden: ‘Fili marie uirgiinis / Succurre nobis miseris’

Label: O sweet Jesu we knowledge this
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to Christ — ten quatrains (aaab) with ‘Te deum laudamus’ refrain and burden: ‘Syng we alle þys tyme þus / Te deum laudamus’

Label: O sweet Lady O Virgin pure
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, ‘Succurre nobis miseris’, an orison to the Virgin Mary — five macaronic quatrains (abab) with this refrain and burden (bb): ‘O mater summi iudicis / Succurre nobis miseris’

Label: O very life of sweetness and hope
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: A prayer to the Virgin Mary, paraphrasing the antiphon, ‘Salve regina’ (Anal. Hymn. L.318-19) — five 3-line stanzas with 2-line burden: ‘Salve regina mater misericordie / Uita dulcedo et spes nostra salue’

Label: O Virgin chaste both first and last
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, an orison to the Virgin Mary — three quatrains (aabb) including refrain, ‘Ora pro nobis’ and burden: ‘Sancta maria ora pro nobis’

Label: O worthy Lord and most of might
_description: A macaronic song to Christ — four quatrains (abab) with Latin caudae and burden (bb): ‘Into this world now ys cum / Christe, redemptor omnium’

Label: Of a maid Christ did not forsake
Subjects: carols, of the Trinity;Trinity, carols to
_description: James Ryman, a song of praise to God — seven quatrains (aaab) with ‘Te deum laudamus’ refrain and burden: ‘Dulciter pangamus / Te deum laudamus’

Label: Of all thy friends She is the flower
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: A song in praise of the Virgin Mary — six quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘Asay, asay’ and burden: ‘Man asay say say / Make thi mone to mary þat mild m[ay]’

Label: Of Mary a maid without leasing
_description: James Ryman, A carol listing the events in the life of Christ — seven quatrains (aaab) including Latin refrain and/or burden: ‘Te deum laudamus’

Label: Of Mary Christ was bore
_description: A Nativity carol — three quatrains (aaab) and 4-line burden: ‘Haue mercy of me kyng of blisse / As muche as thy mercy ys’ (repeated)

Label: Of Mary de…
_description: Fragment of a carol, perhaps on the Annunciation, with notation, and with a refrain beginning, ‘ffarewell lo…’, on a binding fragment

Label: Of one that is so fair and bright
Note: For a fifteenth-century version, see 88.
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: A macaronic song in praise of the Virgin Mary — five 9-line stanzas (ababccdcd)

Label: Of serving men I will begin
Note: See 2407; ‘Troly, loley’ refrain is 2nd and 4th line of each stanza.
Subjects: servants, praise of;carols, amorous;women, as speakers/narrators
_description: In Praise of Serving Men — eight quatrains (abab) and 4-line burden: ‘So well ys me begone / Troly lole’ (repeated)

Label: Of this martyr make we mend
_description: A song for St. Stephen’s Day — three macaronic quatrains (abab) and burden (bb): ‘Eya martir stephane / Prey for vs we prey to þe’

Label: Omnes gentes plaudite / Car nostre saueyour est ne
_description: A macaronic carol of the Nativity in Latin, French, and English — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Nouo profusi gaudio / Benedicamus domino’

Label: On Christmas day in the morn
Note: For another version, see 21.
_description: The life of Christ, a lullaby carol — nine quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘Sweet Jesus is his name’ and four-line burden (cccb): ‘This babe was born I wis / To be the king of bliss / Our Saviour as he is / Sweet Iesus is his name’

Label: On Christs day I understand
Subjects: carols, of the Eucharist;Christ, attributes of
_description: A song of Christ, an Ear of Wheat — five quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘A blessid byrd as I you say / Þat dyed & rose on good fryday’

Label: On twelfth day came kings three
_description: James Ryman, an Epiphany carol — six quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘Beholde to you gret joy I bring / For owe is born crist heuen king’

Label: On twelfth day this star so clear
_description: James Ryman, an Epiphany carol — twelve 6-line stanzas (ababcc) including refrain, ‘This sterre that day tho went away / ffro that swete place where Ihesus lay’ and burden: ‘A sterre shone bright on xii day / Ouer þat place where Ihesus lay’

Label: Our king went forth to Normandy
_description: The Agincourt Carol — six 5-line stanzas (aaaab) including refrain: ‘Deo gracias’, and burden (cc): ‘Deo gracias Anglia / Redde pro victoria’

Label: Our ship is launched from the ground
_description: ‘De Navi vel Puppe. A.D. 1458’, political verses on the State by a Lancastrian — two 4-line stanzas (aaab) plus burden (b): ‘Stere well the good shype God be our gyde’

Label: Out of the blossom sprang a thorn
Note: For a variant see 5566.
_description: An Epiphany carol — twelve quatrains (aaab) with refrain element, ‘…his moder Marie’, burden lacking

Label: Out of the chaff was pured this corn
Subjects: carols, to saints;Thomas of Canterbury, saint
_description: A song in honour of St. Thomas of Canterbury — two 6-line stanzas (aaabbb) with 3-line ‘O martir Thoma’ refrain and 4-line burden: ‘Clangat tuba martir th[o]m[a] / Vt liberet sic cristi vinea’ (repeated)

Label: Out of the east a star shone bright
_description: An Epiphany carol — eight quatrains (aaab) plus burden (bb): ‘Be mery all þat be present / Omnes de saba venient’

Label: Out of your sleep arise and wake
_description: A Christmas carol — six five-line stanzas (aaabb) with ‘Nowel’ refrain and burden (b):‘Nowel nowel nowel nowel nowel nowel’

Label: Out of your sleep arise and wake
_description: James Ryman, a Christmas carol — nine quatrains (aaab) with ‘…virgyn marie quene of blis’ refrain and burden (bb): ‘The sonne of god man bicome is / Of virgyn marie quene of blis’

Label: Over all gates that I have gone
_description: ‘The Ivy-tre’ — nine quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Nowell nowell ell ell / I pray yow lystyn qwat I yow [tell]’

Label: Peerless princess of every place
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, a hymn to the Virgin Mary — eight 6-line stanzas (ababcc) with 2-line refrain, ‘Oure woo þou sease oure joy increse / Graunt us þat pease þat is endlese’ and burden: ‘Vita dulcedo et spes / Nostra maria tu es’

Label: Penny is an hardy knight
Note: See also 2489; for a Latin version, see Wright (1841) XWright, Thomas. The Latin Poems Commonly Attributed to Walter Mapes. Camden Society o.s. 16 (1841), 226.
_description: ‘Sir Peny’ — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Go bet peny go bet go / For þou mat makyn bothe frynd & fo’

Label: Pride is out and pride is in
_description: A song against Pride — five quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘Man be war er þu be wo /Þink on pride & let hym goo’

Label: Puer natus hodie sit we down…
_description: Fragment of a macaronic Christmas carol

Label: Rachel that weepeth without consolation
_description: Carol on epiphany, or slaughter of the innocents — two quatrains (abcb) including refrain, ‘Vox in rama audita est’ plus burden: ‘Syng we now þe holy feste / Vox in rama audita est’

Label: Regina celi letare / For Christ Thy Son so dear
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, ‘Regina celi letare’, a hymn — three 8-line stanzas and 4-line burden: ‘Regina celi letare / With God and man alsoo / Quem meruisti portare / Withowten peyn and woo’ (alternate Latin and English lines throughout)

Label: Robin Hood in Barnesdale stood
_description: A nonsense carol, six unrhymed quatrains with ‘downe downe downe’ burden

Label: Saint John is Christs darling dear
Subjects: carols, to saints;John the Evangelist, saint
_description: John Audelay, a carol for St. John the Evangelist’s Day — ten quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘I pray youe breder euerechon / Worchip þis postil swete saynt jon’

Label: Saint Nicholas was of great post
_description: A carol to St. Nicholas — seven irregular quatrains and burden: ‘Alle maydenis for godes grace / Worchepe ȝe seynt nicolas’

Label: Saint Stephen the first martyr
_description: John Audelay, ‘In die sancti stephani’, — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘In reuerens of oure lord in heuen / Worchip this marter swete sent steuen’

Label: Saluator mundi domine
_description: A macaronic Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Alleluya Alleluya deo patri sit gloria’

Label: Semenaunt is a wonder thing
_description: A song of ‘Seeming’ — six quatrains and burden: ‘I may seyn & so mown mo / Þat in semenaunt goth gyle’

Label: She is gentle and also wise
_description: On the beauty of his mistress — six 3-line stanzas (including refrain, ‘Þat ever I saw’) and burden: ‘My lady is a prety on / A prety prety prety on / My lady is a prety on / As ever I saw’

Label: She saw these women all bedene
Note: For similar pieces see 2512 and 6781.
_description: A song in praise of women — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: Pray we to oure lady dere / For here holy grace

Label: Sinful man thou art unkind
Subjects: Christ, appeal of, to man;carols, of the Passion
_description: The Appeal of Christ to the sinner — six 7-line stanzas (ababccd) with 4-line burden: ‘Blow þe winde styl & blow nat so shyl / My blode man I shed for þe al at wyl / Blowe þe winde styl & blowe nat so shyll / Þis paine to suffre is my fathers wil’

Label: Sit amongst the knights all
_description: Of Discreet Behavior — six quatrains (aaab) with ‘Whatsoeuer ye thynk avyse ye wele’ refrain and burden: ‘He haþ myn hart euery dele / Þat can love true & kepe yt wele’

Label: Sith Christ hath take both flesh and blood
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, A carol to the Virgin Mary — six quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘O benigna laude digna / tuo nato nos consigna’

Label: Sith God hath chose thee to be his knight
Note: See penultimate line of 5731 for echo of first line here
_description: ‘Edwardus IV Dei gratia’ — eight quatrains (aaab) including ‘Edwardes dei gracia’ refrain and burden: A a a / Edwardeus dai gracia

Label: Sith of right thou mayest not forsake
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, An orison to the Virgin Mary — six quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘O virgo summe decora / Pro nobis cristum exora’

Label: Sith the time I knew you first
_description: ‘Why soo vnkende’ — six couplets with three-line burden: ‘Why soo vnkende alas / Why soo vnkende to me / Soo to be kende to me’

Label: Sith Thou hast born the King of Grace
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: An orison to the Virgin Mary — six quatrains (abab) with refrain, ‘Ora pro nobis’ and burden: ‘To þe we make oure mone / Moder of crist alone’

Label: Sith Thou hast born the King of Grace
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: An orison to the Virgin Mary — five quatrains (aaab) with ‘O dulcis maria’ refrain and burden: ‘O clemens O pia / O dulcis maria’

Label: Sith Thy Son is both God and man
Subjects: carols, to Virgin Mary;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: James Ryman, An orison to the Virgin Mary — six quatrains (aaab) with ‘Tuum precare filium’ refrain and burden: ‘O castitatis lilium / Tuum precare filium’

Label: So blessed a sight it was to see
_description: Dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Child — eight quatrains aaab and six-line last stanza ababaa with refrain, ‘Myn own dere moder syng lulley’ and burden: ‘Lulley Jhesu lulley lulley / Myn own dere moder syng lulley’

Label: Solomon the wise he taught in his life
_description: An anti-marital carol — 6 five-line stanzas (aaaab) and burden: ‘All fresche, all fresch, fresch is my song’

Label: Some be merry and some be sad
_description: Carol on the different kinds of women — six 6-line stanzas (aaabccb) including refrain, ‘Yet all be not so / For sum be lewde & sum be shrewed / Go shrew wher so euer ye go’, and burden (dd): ‘Women women love of women / Makeþ bare pursis wiþ sum men’.

Label: Some time I loved as ye may see
_description: A Slighted Lover’s Complaint — nine quatrains (aaab) and burden (b): Who so lyst to loue god send hym right good spede

Label: Sometime I loved so do I yet
_description: The Delivered Lover — eight quatrains (aaab) and burden (cb): ‘Vp son and mery wether / Somer draweth nere’

Label: Sore this deer stricken is
Note: Cf. 6503. See Ringler Jr. (1992) XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 1455.
_description: William Cornish, An enigmatic stricken deer carol — six cross-rhymed quatrains with a 3-line burden: ‘Blow þy horn hunter and blow þi horne on hye / Ther ys a do in yonder wode in faith she woll not dy / ow blow þi hore hunter and blow þi horne joly hunter’

Label: Sovereign lord in earth most excellent
_description: A carol for the king (perhaps Henry VII) — two stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘Enforce yourself as goddis knyght / To strenkyþ your comyns in þer ryght’ (repeated)

Label: Steel is good I say no other
_description: Women compared to steel — five quatrains and burden: ‘War yt war yt war yt wele / Wemen be as trew as stele’

Label: Sure song in time past hath been doun a doun
_description: A ‘ballet’ sung at the Conduit in Cheap in honor of Edward VI, c. 1548 — six long quatrains (aabb) and burden: ‘Syng vp hart syng up hart an[d] syng no more do[w]ne / But joy in king edward þat wereth the crowne’

Label: Sweet Jesu is come to us
_description: A nativity carol on life of Jesus — twenty-one 6-line stanzas (aabccb) plus burden: ‘Hey now now now’

Label: That Archangel shining full bright
_description: James Ryman, On the Annunciation — four stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘As gabriell archaungell seyde / Now criste is borne of a pure meyde’

Label: That heart my heart hath in such grace
_description: Two Loving Hearts — six quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘For [wele or w]oo I wyll not fle / To love þat hart þat lovyth me’

Label: That holy clerk Saint Augustine
_description: James Ryman, A song of Repentance — six quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Amende we vs while we haue space / For why nowe is þe tyme of grace’

Label: That lord that lay in an ass stall
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) with ‘Qui natus fuit hodie’ refrain and burden: ‘Iblessid be þat lord in mageste / Qui natus fuit hodie’

Label: That maiden mild her child did keep
_description: James Ryman, Dialogue between the Virgin Mary and her Child — fourteen quatrains (abab) each ending with the word ‘alone’ and burden: ‘Mary hath borne alone / The sonne of god in trone’

Label: That nine months was encluse
Note: Listed by Greene by burden; see Greene (1977) XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977 (see also Greene (1935) XGreene, Richard Leighton. The Early English Carols. Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon, 1977), 355.
_description: Of the Nativity — three 2-line stanzas and burden: ‘Mayde and moder glade thou be / For nou þou myst [th]y son ysee’

Label: That periwinkle had encumbered our town
Subjects: carols, political;political verse;Kent;Fogge, sir John, of Repton, Ashford, Kent
_description: ‘The Briar and the Periwinkle’, a partisan political carol from a rent-roll of Ashford, Kent — four 8-line stanzas (abababcd) and 4-line burden: ‘Man of mightt þat al hed ydyght / An knowys heuery wronge / Into de blysse dow ws wysse / Dow spedys yn owre songe’

Label: That was Jesu our saviour
_description: A song in praise of Christ and the Virgin Mary — four quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Honour be euer wiþowtyn ende / To hym þat fro þe hevyn discende’

Label: The angel said of high degree / Hail full of grace Christ is with thee
_description: James Ryman, ‘Inquit Marie Gabriell’, an Annunciation carol — nine quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Inquit marie gabriell / Concipies emmanuel’

Label: The angel said of high degree / Hail full of grace God is with thee
_description: James Ryman, ‘Alma redemptoris mater’ — thirteen quatrains including refrain, ‘Alma Redemptoris’ or ‘Redemptoris mater’, and burden: ‘Alma redemptoris mater / Quem de celis misit pater’

Label: The bishop Scrope that was so wise
Subjects: Scrope, Richard le, archbishop of York;carols, political;political poems
_description: Carol on the death of Archbishop Scrope — four quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Hay hay hay hay / Thynke on whitson monday’

Label: The boars head in hand I bring
_description: A Boar’s Head carol — eight quatrains (aab) and burden: ‘Hey hey hey hey / The borrys hede is armyd gay’

Label: The boars head in hands I bring
_description: A Boar’s Head carol — three quatrains (aaab) and burden: ‘Caput apri Refero / Resonens laudes domino’

Label: The boars head that we bring here
_description: A Christmas carol — three quatrains (aaab) with ‘Nowell nowelle’ refrain and 4-line burden: ‘Nowell nowell nowell nowell / Tydynges gode y thyng[ke] to telle’ (repeated)

Label: The Father of heaven from above
Note: First stanza almost identical with stanza 1 of 5328; stanza 9 is a variant of stanza 5 of 4126.
_description: A carol to the Trinity — ten quatrains (aaab) and Latin burden: ‘Te deum laudamus / Te dominum confitemur’

Label: The Father of heaven his own Son he sent
_description: A ‘Lullay’ carol of the Nativity — in 3-line stanzas (aab) including ‘So blyssid be the tyme’ refrain and burden: ‘A new yer a newe yer a chyld was iborn / Vs for to sauyn þat al was forlorn / So blyssid be the tyme’

Label: The Fathers Son of heaven bliss / Of a pure maid man become is
_description: James Ryman, A song of the Nativity and Passion — eight quatrains (aaab) and burden (bb): ‘The sone of god alone / Hath made vs free echeone’

Label: The Fathers Son of heaven bliss / Of a pure Maid man become is
_description: A song of the Nativity, in James Ryman’s songbook — three 4-line stanzas (aaab) with ‘Te deum’ refrain and burden(bb): ‘Dulciter pangamus / Te deum laudamus’

Label: The Fathers Son of heaven bliss / That is the Lord…
_description: A song of the Annunciation, in James Ryman’s songbook — seven five-line stanzas (ababc) including ‘Mirabile misterium’ refrain and burden (cc): ‘Mirabile misterium / The sone of god ys man becum’

Label: The first day of yule han we in mind
_description: A Christmas carol — eight quatrains (aaab) and 3-line burden: ‘Make we myrth / For crystes byrth / & syng we yole tyl candelmes’

Label: The first day when Christ was born
_description: A Christmas carol — five quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘I thanke it a maydyn euery dyll’ and burden: ‘Nowel el el el el / I thank it a maydyn euery del’

Label: The first it is thy hearing
Subjects: wits, five bodily;carols, of religious counsel
_description: John Audelay, A song of the Five Bodily Wits — five 5-line stanzas (ababc) and burden: ‘Thy v wittis loke þat wele spende / & thonke þat lord þat ham þe sende’

Label: The first Joy as I You tell
Subjects: Virgin Mary, joys of;carols, to Virgin Mary
_description: The Five Joys of the Virgin Mary — five quatrains (aaab) with refrain, ‘Wiþ fader and sone and holy gost’ and burden: ‘I may synge of a may / Of joyis fyve & merthis most’

Label: The high Father of bliss above
_description: James Ryman, an Annunciation carol — eight stanzas rhyme royal and burden: ‘In criste ihesu be we alle gladde / By whome oure joye endeles is hadde’
